title: Textile, mid-20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: stitched-resist, indigo-dyed, plain weave foundation
dimensions: Warp x Weft (weft selvedge to selvedge): 196.2 x 81 cm (6 ft. 5 1/4 in. x 31 7/8 in.)
description: Type of adire cloth called 'agasofin'. Pattern of white on blue is produced by resisting the dye with oversewing, wrapping, and tying with raffia, then vat-dying in indigo. Traces of the raffia sewing thread are still present.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, mid-20th century.
mid-20th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: stitched-resist, indigo-dyed, plain weave foundation. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-317.
